img.alt: Book Delivery1
img.title: A Project Full of Heart

div.p:
Erin Holtkamp, an ENL teacher at George Washington School, took it upon herself to ensure students’ needs are being met at home by donating books to families in the community.
“While making phone calls to some of my students’ homes, I asked one of them if they had books to read at home. To my surprise, they were confused by the question,” said Holtkamp. Many of her students’ families... Read More >

img.title: Congratulations to West Hempstead High School Athletes

h3.a: Congratulations to West Hempstead High School Athletes

div.p:
Congratulations to the West Hempstead High School athletes who earned the below recognitions for the 2019/2020 winter season.
STATE QUALIFIER Victoria Guerrier – Girls Varsity Winter Track
ALL COUNTY Eric Anderson – Boys Varsity Winter Track Oluwadolapo Babalola – Boys Varsity Winter Track Derek Chinchilla – Boys Varsity Winter Track Madelyn Close – Varsity... Read More >

img.alt: VIDEO: Supporting Dreams in West Hempstead
img.title: VIDEO: Supporting Dreams in West Hempstead

h3.a: VIDEO: Supporting Dreams in West Hempstead

div.p:
Kayla Charles is a fifth grade student at George Washington who aspires to be a pediatric surgeon. Director of Innovative Educational Opportunities Ryan Emmanuel-Cooke admired Kayla’s goals and began speaking more with her about her future plans. Mr. Emmanuel-Cooke decided to reach out to a cousin to surprise Kayla with a very special video call.
Dr. Ala Stanford is the first African American female... Read More >
